Class Renderer

  renderer.Renderer

extends java.lang.Object

Constructor Detail

Renderer

public Renderer(int width,
                int height,
                Camera camera)
Creates the renderer. If zero is passed in for width and height, it runs fullscreen.

Parameters:
width - The width of the renderer.
height - The height of the renderer.
camera - The camera associated with the renderer.
Method Detail

bindNewModel

public boolean bindNewModel(Model model)
There will be a class called "Model" which will have all the data that will be bound to a VBO (anything needed to render) and then bound to a VAO(such as texture, vertex position, color, etc). This will PROBABLY make things easier becaues it will abstract creating new models and the actual rendering.

Returns:
true if the binding was successful and false otherwise.
See Also:
Model

renderScene

public void renderScene()
Renders the new scene.

public Camera getCamera()
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Get the camera associated with this renderer.

Returns:
the camera
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException

initOpenGL

private void initOpenGL(boolean fullscreen)
Initializes OpenGL (currently using 3.2).

Parameters:
fullscreen - Determines whether we should run in fullscreen.
